name: Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim

indications.text: sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection combination sulfamethoxazole , sulfonamide antimicrobial , trimethoprim , dihydrofolate reductase inhibitor antibacterial , indicated adults pediatric patients two months age older treatment infections caused designated , susceptible bacteria . pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia ( 1.1 ) shigellosis ( 1.2 ) urinary tract infections ( 1.3 ) reduce development drug-resistant bacteria maintain effectiveness sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection antibacterial drugs , sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection used treat prevent infections proven strongly suspected caused susceptible bacteria . ( 1.4 )

contraindications.text: guidelines adults pediatric patients ( two months age older ) infection total daily dose ( based trimethoprim content ) frequency duration pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia 15 20 mg/kg ( 3 4 equally divided doses ) every 6 8 hours 14 days severe urinary tract infections 8 10 mg/kg ( 2 4 equally divided doses ) every 6 , 8 12 hours 14 days shigellosis 8 10 mg/kg ( 2 4 equally divided doses ) every 6 , 8 12 hours 5 days patients impaired renal function , reduced employed . ( 2.2 ) sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection must given intravenous infusion period 60 90 minutes . rapid infusion bolus injection must avoided . ( 2.3 ) sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection must diluted 5 % dextrose water solution prior . ( 2.4 ) mix sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection drugs solutions . ( 2.4 )

warningsAndPrecautions: sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection , usp supplied follows : ndc numbers sulfamethoxazole , usp strength trimethoprim , usp strength pack size 0703-9503-03 400 mg/5 ml ( 80 mg/ml ) 80 mg/5 ml ( 16 mg/ml ) 5 ml single-dose amber vials packaged 10 per carton . 0703-9514-03 800 mg/10 ml ( 80 mg/ml ) 160 mg/10 ml ( 16 mg/ml ) 10 ml multiple-dose amber vials packaged 10 per carton . 0703-9526-01 2400 mg/30 ml ( 80 mg/ml ) 480 mg/30 ml ( 16 mg/ml ) 30 ml multiple-dose amber vials packaged individually . store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . refrigerate .
adverseReactions: sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim injection contraindicated following situations : known hypersensitivity trimethoprim sulfonamides [ ( 5.2 ) ] history drug-induced immune thrombocytopenia trimethoprim and/or sulfonamides [ ( 5.4 ) ] documented megaloblastic anemia due folate deficiency [ ( 5.11 ) ] pediatric patients less two months age [ ( 8.4 ) ] marked hepatic damage [ ( 5.11 , 5.14 ) ] severe renal insufficiency renal function status monitored [ ( 5.11 , 5.14 ) ] concomitant dofetilide2,3 [ ( 7 ) ]
indications_original: Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection is a combination of sulfamethoxazole, a sulfonamide antimicrobial, and trimethoprim, a dihydrofolate reductase inhibitor antibacterial, indicated in adults and pediatric patients two months of age and older for treatment of infections caused by designated, susceptible bacteria. Pneumocystis jirovecii Pneumonia ( 1.1 ) Shigellosis ( 1.2 ) Urinary Tract Infections ( 1.3 ) To reduce the development of drug-resistant bacteria and maintain the effectiveness of Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection and other antibacterial drugs, Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection should be used only to treat or prevent infections that are proven or strongly suspected to be caused by susceptible bacteria. ( 1.4 )
contraindications_original: Dosage Guidelines For Adults and Pediatric Patients (Two Months of Age and Older) Infection Total Daily Dose (based on trimethoprim content) Frequency Duration Pneumocystis jirovecii Pneumonia 15 to 20 mg/kg (in 3 or 4 equally divided doses) Every 6 to 8 hours 14 days Severe Urinary Tract Infections 8 to 10 mg/kg (in 2 to 4 equally divided doses) Every 6, 8 or 12 hours 14 days Shigellosis 8 to 10 mg/kg (in 2 to 4 equally divided doses) Every 6, 8 or 12 hours 5 days For patients with impaired renal function, a reduced dosage should be employed. ( 2.2 ) Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection must be given by intravenous infusion over a period of 60 to 90 minutes. Rapid infusion or bolus injection must be avoided. ( 2.3 ) Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection must be diluted in 5% dextrose in water solution prior to administration. ( 2.4 ) Do not mix Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection with other drugs or solutions. ( 2.4 )

adverseReactions_original:
Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim Injection is contraindicated in the following situations:
                  
                     Known hypersensitivity to trimethoprim or sulfonamides [see Warnings and Precautions (5.2)]
                     
                     History of drug-induced immune thrombocytopenia with use of trimethoprim and/or sulfonamides [see Warnings and Precautions (5.4)]
                     
                     Documented megaloblastic anemia due to folate deficiency [see Warnings and Precautions (5.11)]
                     
                     Pediatric patients less than two months of age [see Use in Specific Populations (8.4)]
                     
                     Marked hepatic damage [see Warnings and Precautions (
                              5.11
                           , 5.14)]
                     
                     Severe renal insufficiency when renal function status cannot be monitored [see Warnings and Precautions (
                              
                                 5.11
                              , 
                                 5.14
                              
                           )]
                     
                     Concomitant administration with dofetilide2,3 
                        [see Drug Interactions (7)]
